alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jasper; Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 15 at 4:07AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rain, snowmelt, and break up ice jams is possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Illinois and northwest Indiana, including the following counties, in east central Illinois, Ford and Iroquois. In northwest Indiana, Benton, Jasper and Newton. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying, flood-prone, and poor drainage areas. Also, rising river levels and warmer temperatures may result in river ice becoming dislodged increasing the risk of localized ice jam flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall of one to two inches is expected Wednesday night into Thursday morning which will be falling on frozen ground leading to quick runoff. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
